definition: point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)
Young Pioneers of China (primary school league, a preparation for Communist Youth League)/abbr. to 少先隊|少先队

sentences.english: In the pilot, we are introduced to Felicity's creepy roommate.
sentences.chinese: 先鋒隊中介紹了費的令人毛骨悚然的室友。

sentences.english: Hence, at certain hours, a profound cold broods over the magnanimous vanguard of the human race.
sentences.chinese: 這些原因使這些人有時對人類偉大的先鋒隊極端冷漠。
什麼叫做先鋒隊的作用？

sentences.english: I am a member of the Young Pioneers of China.
sentences.chinese: 我是中國少年先鋒隊隊員。

sentences.english: They will be vanguard of any change.
sentences.chinese: 他們將先鋒隊的任何變化。

sentences.english: The program was started by the Ministry of Education and the Chinese YoungPioneers.
sentences.chinese: 這一項目是由教育部和中國少年先鋒隊啓動的。

sentences.english: Girls and boys met only in the House of Pioneers.
sentences.chinese: 男孩女孩們只有在先鋒隊辦公室纔會聚在一起。

sentences.english: They are the vanguards of the working class.
sentences.chinese: 他們是工人階級的先鋒隊。

sentences.english: We can mould the Party and the world only in the image of the proletarian vanguard.
sentences.chinese: 只能依照無產階級先鋒隊的面貌改造黨，改造世界。

sentences.english: A new generation of young pioneers making a difference.
sentences.chinese: 你們是可以改變世界的新生代先鋒隊。

sentences.english: Your team is the Pioneers, after all.

definition: to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
full of sap (idiom); young and vigorous
junior high school (Tw)/abbr. to 國中|国中[guo2 zhong1]
amphibious/dual-talented/able to work in two different lines
